occurrences.text: God said he was gonna preserve it because God is trustworthy and dependable and always does what he says he will do, we can rest assured that God has indeed preserved his Word. Notice, if you will, in Psalm 119 in verse number 89, the Bible tells us, of course, you're familiar with this chapter in Psalm 119 dealing with the Word of God and all the wonderful characteristics and the ways in which the psalmist is relating to the Word of God and its place in his life. And here in Psalm 119 in verse 89, the Bible says, forever, O Lord, thy Word is settled in heaven. Forever. His Word is settled in heaven. Jesus said this in Matthew 24 in verse number 35 as he's speaking here and giving instruction, he gives note with regard to the Word of God and he says, heaven and earth shall pass away, but my words shall not pass away. There are people that are trying to revise the Bible. They're trying to remove the Bible, right? We live in a society in which they're trying to revise it, they're trying to remove it, but we find that God has promised that he's going to preserve it. And it doesn't matter, as we mentioned this morning, our God is victorious. It doesn't matter of the scheme and plan of the evil one and the wicked one to try to rid our society of this book.
